description: A small, modest house on Drum Island where Dr. Hiriluk lived and conducted his medical experiments. This is where he took in Chopper and where they lived together.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Wakes Up and Cries
keyEvents.description: Chopper wakes up in Hiriluk's house for the first time, bandaged and cared for. He cries while eating bread, overwhelmed by kindness.
keyEvents.significance: The house becomes a symbol of safety and acceptance for Chopper - the first place he ever felt welcome.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Speaks for the First Time
keyEvents.description: After three days living in Hiriluk's house, Chopper finally speaks to Hiriluk.
keyEvents.significance: The house represents a safe space where Chopper can be himself without fear.

keyEvents.title: Hiriluk Drives Chopper Away
keyEvents.description: Hiriluk forces Chopper to leave the house, shooting at him to drive him away.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the end of Chopper's brief period of happiness and safety.

climate: Winter Island - perpetually covered in snow
politicalStatus: Located in Drum Kingdom under Wapol's tyrannical rule
historicalSignificance: The home where Chopper experienced acceptance and family for the first time. A crucial location in Chopper's character development.
